This game is a all time classic. It still holds up.
The levels are great and so immersive. The puzzles are creative and not so difficult that you get stuck. 
The fact that there are multiple solutions for problems is great. Gives you a real sense of freedom.
When I played this game as a kid I was not skilled enough to get very far. 
Now replaying it to finish it.
Even nowadays a really good game.

I really loved half life 1 and had pretty high expectations, but was kind of dissappointed. It's just not as fun as the first one. I think one of the reasons for this is that you don't fight any aliens for a big part of the game, instead you fight humans, which is not as exciting.

What's amazing about Half-Life 2 is that it's quality manages to be on par with the first game while not feeling derivative of it, there's so much innovation here which makes it one of the most remarkable sequels ever made in my opinion.

What's consistent with the first Half-Life is the pacing, to put it simply, it is fantastic. Each chapter feels different than the last, more mechanics are regularly being introduced and you rarely find yourself repeating anything you've already done earlier in the game. I really like the variety in environment as well, and all the different locations fit really well in the world the game is set in. This is, in my opinion, the strongest similarity this game has to the first Half-Life.

What I think Half-Life 2 does better than the first game is the characters and story, there are interesting characters and the story feels a lot more fleshed out and deeply thought out compared to Half-Life 1 which was more basic by comparison. This focus on characters and story can diminish replay value, as you are required to sit through certain sections which are there to give exposition, these parts are perfectly fine for a first playthrough but drag on too long if you have already played the game before and know the story.

The gameplay ends up feeling very different from Half-Life 1 a lot of the time due to the use of the physics engine in the game, this change is for the better in my opinion because it gives you some really cool options for combat where you just blast props at the enemies with the gravity gun. There are other things like vehicles that add to the gameplay loop and keep things from getting stale. There are less weapons than Half-Life 1, but the gravity gun makes up for the absence of those weapons because it's just that fun to use.

As a sequel to an all-time classic, Half-Life 2 is absolutely amazing, usually a sequel is just derivative of the previous game, but Half-Life 2 evolves what the original game did into something both new yet familiar to fans of the original. It's definitely one of the best videogame sequels I've ever played.
